title: 103_hr5098
content: The "Fort Peck Tribes-Montana Compact Act of 1994" approves, ratifies, and confirms the water rights agreement between the Fort Peck Indian Tribes and Montana. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for the delivery, use, or transfer of water rights confirmed in the Tribes by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, with approval from the Secretary. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission, or 60 days after compliance with relevant laws. Parties can enforce the agreement under section 1361 of title 28, United States Code, and the Department of the Interior must maintain confidentiality. Federal law allows parties to enforce Water Agreements under section 1361 of title 28, United States Code. The Department of the Interior must treat certain information as privileged and proprietary to the Tribes. The Tribes consider any financial benefit from a Water Agreement as privileged information. They are limited from authorizing tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for economic development. The Treasury deposits 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin programs annually. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for economic development. The Secretary of the Treasury deposits 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin programs annually, up to a maximum of $50,000,000. Interest accrued on the deposits is available for tribal economic development without fiscal year limitation. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for economic development. Interest accrues on deposits in a separate account in the Treasury and is available for tribal economic development without fiscal year limitation. Payments from the fund are for tribal economic development and land acquisition, subject to Secretary approval. Amounts deposited are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable, and payments do not reduce or deny Federal services or programs for the Tribes. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" allows for tribal economic development and land acquisition with Secretary approval. Deposited amounts are nonreimbursable, nonreturnable, and not subject to income tax. Payments do not affect federal services or programs for the Tribes. No distribution to tribal members on a per capita basis is allowed. Performance by the United States of all required actions under this Act waives claims against the government. The Act prohibits distribution of funds to tribal members on a per capita basis. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for the government's actions under the Act. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact refers to the water rights agreement ratified in 1985. The Reservation is defined as the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The Tribes are the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. Tribal water right is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Tribes" means the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The term "tribal water right" is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "Fund" refers to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund.
